page.title: 17THE RIVER NAILBOURNE BRIDGE
page.content: The Nailbourne River is a chalk stream which flows every now and again.It starts at Lyminge and flows into the River Stour at Plucks Gutter.The Nailbourne flows through{Bourne {Park,Bridge,Patrixbourne}and{ {Bekesbourne.}In Bourne Park there is an old sheep dip.It is sealed off from the river by a brick wall.The sheep got in and out by some steps at the side.The sheep dip is not used anymore Cows and sheep drink out of the Nailbourne. We found out that the river flows towards the North East.The river flows 10 metres in 15 seconds.We did the measurements by the bridge that leads into the Recreation Ground at Bridge.There the Nailbourne is 11cm deep at each side and 8cm deep in the middle.And is 4.50 metres wide.
